Key Match Events: Scotland's Michael Jones and George Munsey forged ahead to 90 without loss in an innings cut in half by heavy rain.
Jones swung Chris Jordan for an 87-metre six which smashed a solar panel on the roof of the stand beyond deep midwicket.
Munsey thrashed the second ball of Chris Jordan's next over the fence at backward square for six.
Pre-Game Insights: Scotland won the toss and opted to bat.
England were forced to settle for a point after underdogs post competitive target of 109 in ten.
Post-Match Reflections: The weather eventually ruined Scotland's opening match against defending champions England.
The rain returned for good and condemned the contest to a wash-out.
Miscellaneous Highlights: A much heavier storm arrived to halt proceedings again just two balls after the powerplay with Scotland reaching 51 for nought off the back of some assured hitting from Jones, who was unbeaten on 30 from 20 balls at the time, and Munsey.
Archer's homecoming continued with a two-over spell, the first going for 10 runs, all to Jones who pounced on some extra width to dispatch his third ball through the covers for four.
